doc.field: Subseries IV: Joint Committee on the Library
Subseries IV: Joint Committee on the Library

Brademas served on the Joint Committee on the Library from 1970 to 1979. Materials mainly address the proposed integration of the Law Library in to the Research Services Department of the Library of Congress. Documents include hearing transcripts, staff memoranda, correspondence, and reports detailing the committee's investigation into the proposed reorganization. Other issues addressed to a lesser extent include Congressional Research Service request for Supergrades, Library of Congress surplus book program, public access policies for the Library of Congress, and a lawsuit against claiming the harassment and intimidation of minority workers.
